specification: Retrieve a paginated list of file metadata entities managed by the system for file uploads and attachments. Related entities are the media assets, attachments, and access logs. This operation does not return the actual file contents, only metadata.

It queries all records in the shopping_mall_ai_files table and returns an array of file metadata, such as original name, extension, URI, and upload date.

Access to this endpoint should be restricted to users with elevated permissions (such as admin) due to the potentially sensitive nature of the stored files and audit requirements. The operation only returns metadata, not the files' contents. Related audit operations may be triggered for file access audits and download histories.

This endpoint enforces authentication and permission checks so only authorized actors (admin, customer, seller, or system auditor) can retrieve sensitive file metadata. For audit or sensitive data, the caller may require role escalation. Soft deletion (deleted_at) is respected. If the file is soft deleted, file metadata will reflect this, and access to the original URI should be blocked in downstream logic.

The response exposes all fields except internal implementation artifacts. Error handling provides valid error messages for file not found, unauthorized access, or compliance violations. This endpoint can be used by UI, CDN, or service-level integrations for detailed file reference and access logging.

This is essential for correcting audit records, updating ownership, or marking files for compliance/legal holds without removing asset data. This operation requires admin privileges or explicit ownership verification to modify file records. Actions such as updating soft deletion (marking deleted_at), updating the original name, or changing actor attribution are subject to audit logging. The endpoint supports system integrity for file correction, legal holds, or post-upload error correction. Strict validation ensures only allowed fields are modified, and audit trails are enforced.

Error cases include permission denied, file not found, or immutable field update attempts. On success, the updated file metadata is returned.

This is used for GDPR compliance, customer requests, or auditing junk file retention. All related file usage, deduplication, and reference logic will reflect this soft deletion.

File deletion requires admin or system-level permissions to prevent accidental or malicious destruction of important assets. The operation is fully audited for compliance. No response body is returned except confirmation of deletion status.

If the record does not exist or the user is unauthorized, meaningful error messages are returned. Downstream services must check deleted_at when serving files to prevent access to deleted resources.

description:
Fetch metadata for a specific media asset file variant using its unique mediaAssetId. The shopping_mall_ai_media_assets table contains variant details, including asset_type (e.g., thumbnail), target URI, media dimensions, and timestamp. Each media asset is associated with a base file reference (file_id).

Authorization is enforced for sensitive asset types: access may be permitted for customers if owned, sellers for their own assets, or admin for all assets. Audit logs can be generated on access. Error responses are returned for unauthorized access, missing assets, or soft deleted/expired references. This supports image/video delivery optimization and compliance audit of all stored variants.
summary: Retrieve a specific file asset variant's metadata from shopping_mall_ai_media_assets.

parameters.name: mediaAssetId
parameters.description: UUID of the media asset to retrieve.

responseBody.description: All metadata about the requested file asset variant.

name: at

specification: This operation allows update of mutable metadata for a specific file asset variant record in shopping_mall_ai_media_assets. Admins and the original file owner (seller or customer) may update asset_type, asset_uri, or dimension metadata. Asset type and URI changes may be restricted except during asset transformation or regeneration workflows, and updates are logged for audit/compliance. This operation maintains asset correctness and supports operations such as reprocessing, correction, or migration of file assets.
description:
Update mutable metadata fields for a specific media asset variant given its mediaAssetId. Permitted fields for update typically include asset_type, asset_uri, width, height, and duration. Updates to related base file reference are restricted.

This operation requires admin-level privileges or asset ownership verification for modification to prevent unauthorized asset re-linking or data corruption. Audit logs are maintained for all updates. Error responses include unauthorized attempt, non-existent asset, or illegal field update. On success, updated asset metadata is returned for confirmation.

Though most file asset records are retained for audit, a soft delete can be done for expired, replaced, or invalid assets per compliance rules. If hard deletion is required for legal or devops, this operation will destroy the asset metadata as well as its reference to the base file.
description:
Delete a media asset variant record from the file management system by its mediaAssetId. If the underlying table supports soft deletes, the operation marks the record as deleted; otherwise, hard deletion occurs. Admin privileges are generally needed to perform file asset deletion, and all actions are logged for audit/compliance.

Attempting to delete a media asset that does not exist, is already deleted, or the caller lacks permission results in error. There is no response body on successful deletion other than confirmation of action status.

description:

Authorization is granted based on attachment/target business object visibility: admins may query any record, while sellers and customers may only query attachments for their own business objects or uploaded files. Error handling covers not found, permission denied, and compliance constraint violations.

The returned object contains all information necessary for audit, reference tracing, or UI asset rendering.

Admin or explicit asset owner permission is required to perform deletion. All deletions are logged for compliance—ensuring digital asset trail for legal investigation or rollback. specification: This operation retrieves metadata and detailed information for a single uploaded file in the shopping mall platform. It is associated with the shopping_mall_ai_files table, which stores original file name, URI, metadata (type, size, hash), actor/uploader identity, and creation/deletion timestamps. It supports digital asset management, compliance audit, and attachment lookup required for file access and traceability. Used by business users and system modules to retrieve authenticated metadata for rendering, security validation, or to validate deduplication and access rights.
description:
Retrieve all metadata and record attributes for a single uploaded file by its unique fileId (UUID). The shopping_mall_ai_files table contains core information including upload details, file hash, original file name, file size, media URI, MIME type, and referencing actor (if any).

This endpoint enforces authentication and permission checks so only authorized actors (admin, customer, seller, or system auditor) can retrieve sensitive file metadata. For audit or sensitive data, the caller may require role escalation. Soft deletion (deleted_at) is respected. If the file is soft deleted, file metadata will reflect this, and access to the original URI should be blocked in downstream logic.

The response exposes all fields except internal implementation artifacts. Error handling provides valid error messages for file not found, unauthorized access, or compliance violations. This endpoint can be used by UI, CDN, or service-level integrations for detailed file reference and access logging.
summary: Get a single file record by fileId from shopping_mall_ai_files table.

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: Unique identifier (UUID) of the file to retrieve.

responseBody.description: File metadata and details matching the requested fileId.

specification: Retrieve detailed access log information for a single file access event. The shopping_mall_ai_file_access_logs table stores granular event attributes like file reference, accessor identity, access type (read, write, etc), channel, outcome, timestamp, and IP. This enables auditability for regulatory compliance, forensic review, and monitoring of suspicious file usage events. Typical users are compliance auditors, admins, or system operators.
description:
Fetch metadata related to one file access log event identified by fileAccessLogId (UUID). The shopping_mall_ai_file_access_logs table logs every access event on files inside the shopping mall platform, including who accessed which file, on what channel, what type of event occurred (e.g., DOWNLOAD, VIEW), its outcome, and access origin (IP, system).

Data returned is restricted to authorized actors (admin, compliance auditor), supporting granular monitoring for abnormal or suspicious usage. Unauthorized access, not found, or restricted-log viewing attempts return error messages. Log detail is essential for incident response, compliance monitoring, and forensics.

Stringent role and field validation applies.

The shopping_mall_ai_file_access_logs table is maintained for compliance and trace purposes; almost all identity, reference, or origin fields are immutable to preserve log integrity.

Admin authorization is strictly enforced. Changes made are auditable and intended only for critical corrections or official annotation during an investigation. Illegal update attempts, non-existent logs, or unauthorized users receive error returns. The outcome includes the fresh access log entry for audit inspection.

If the log row is already deleted or does not exist, no further action is performed.

name: erase

specification: Retrieves a list of products from the shopping mall's product catalog. This operation interfaces with the shopping_mall_ai_products table in the Prisma schema. It returns a paginated listing, including details such as product title, price, status, associated seller, and primary category. It is optimized for browsing and discovery scenarios and supports simple filtering by default business rules. Advanced searching and filtering are available via the PATCH method, while this GET endpoint favors straightforward access. Each product record returned is a detailed object compliant with the normalization rules of the product catalog. Audit fields such as created_at and updated_at are always included. Only products with an active status and proper visibility settings are shown to customers, while admins and sellers may see all statuses based on role and ownership.
description:
Fetches a simple, paginated list of all products currently available in the shopping mall catalog. This operation is ideal for customer-side browsing, marketing display, and basic administrative overviews.

The returned product objects are derived directly from the shopping_mall_ai_products table. Fields include unique product ID, seller reference, main category, title, description, price, SKU, status, and audit timestamps. Products belonging to inactive sellers or categories may be excluded based on business rules and the user's role.

Permission to view inactive or draft products is restricted to their owning seller or platform admins. Pagination is applied to manage large collections efficiently; clients should use the PATCH method for search, sort, and advanced filtering.

Common error scenarios include requesting pages outside available range, forbidden access to restricted products, and insufficient permissions. This endpoint is rate-limited for non-admin roles to prevent scraping.
summary: Retrieve a paginated list of products from the catalog (shopping_mall_ai_products).

responseBody.description: Paginated list of product objects as defined in the product catalog schema.

name: index

specification: Performs advanced, paginated, and filtered search of products within the shopping mall's product catalog. Operations are based on the shopping_mall_ai_products schema and support complex queries including multi-field search, price ranges, category/seller filtering, and status selection. This endpoint supports business reporting and analytics use-cases, as well as marketplace discovery. The request body should include search criteria following IShoppingMallAiProduct.IRequest, and results will be delivered as a paginated response with summary detail optimized for high-performance UI rendering.
description:
Enables advanced, multi-criteria product search in the shopping mall catalog. This operation draws from the shopping_mall_ai_products table, providing search and filtering according to product title, price, seller, category, status, SKU, and date fields. It also accepts pagination and sort instructions.

The PATCH method is designed for customers, sellers, and admins needing precise control over product discovery, analytics, or audit. Users submit search filters in the request body according to the IShoppingMallAiProduct.IRequest structure. The response delivers a paged list of matched product summaries.

Customers will only see products that are active and available for purchase. Sellers and admins may search their own or all products, according to role-based access rules. The API enforces business logic for excluded/hidden items and applies permissions for field visibility.

Possible errors include malformed queries, excessive result sets, and unauthorized access to administrative product data. Performance optimizations are enabled for large-scale discovery workflows.
summary: Advanced paginated product search with filtering (shopping_mall_ai_products).

requestBody.description: Advanced product search criteria and pagination settings.

responseBody.description: Paginated list of filtered product summaries, matching supplied criteria.

name: search

specification: Retrieves a single, fully detailed product from the shopping mall product catalog, by unique product ID. This operation targets the shopping_mall_ai_products table using a specified product ID as the primary parameter. It returns all core fields for the product including seller, category, audit metadata, and product-specific details. It includes all non-sensitive information permitted for the current user's role, applying business rules for inactive or restricted products. The endpoint is suitable for detailed product views, seller management, or admin audits.
description:
Fetches a single product's full detail from the shopping_mall_ai_products table using the provided product ID. The response includes seller, category, description, SKU, price, current status, inventory relationships, option blocks, audit timestamps, and all associated links as per the data model.

Role-based logic controls which product states (active, inactive, archived) are visible to each user. Customers typically only access active, public items. Sellers and admins may access all products they own or manage, including drafts or archived records. Audit fields and related entities are included for administrative use-cases.

Error cases include missing product ID, non-existent product, or insufficient permissions. Permissions and data filtering are enforced for sensitive fields according to platform business rules and requirements.
summary: Get a fully-detailed product by ID (shopping_mall_ai_products).

parameters.name: shoppingMallAiProductId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the target product to retrieve.

responseBody.description: Full detail of a single product, including core and audit fields.

name: at

specification: Creates a new product in the shopping mall's product catalog. Inserts a row into the shopping_mall_ai_products schema, requiring all mandatory product details such as title, category, price, description, SKU, seller association, and status. Only users with seller or admin privileges can access this endpoint. All product registration logic and field validation follow the data model's normalization and audit requirements. Returns the created product including its unique ID and timestamps.
description:
Registers a new product in the catalog by inserting a row into the shopping_mall_ai_products table. All required fields—seller reference, main category, title, description, price, SKU, and status—must be provided in the request body following the IShoppingMallAiProduct.ICreate DTO definition.

This operation is restricted to authenticated sellers and admins. On success, the endpoint returns the full product object, including ID, audit fields, and all normalized attributes. Input validity is strictly enforced according to schema requirements: unique SKU per seller, price as a floating point, and normalized references for category and seller.

Common errors include duplicate SKUs, invalid references (e.g. missing categories or sellers), and missing required fields. Business rules for allowed product states (draft, active, etc.) and audit traceability are enforced.
summary: Create a new product (shopping_mall_ai_products).

requestBody.description: Required fields for product creation—title, description, price, SKU, category, seller, status.

responseBody.description: The newly created product object, with IDs and audit data populated.

The endpoint returns the updated product in full detail.
description:
Modifies an existing product identified by the given product ID in the shopping_mall_ai_products table. All updatable fields (excluding immutable or audit-only fields) may be changed via this endpoint, abiding by business logic for product management.

Only product owners (seller) and platform admins may call this operation. The request body should follow the IShoppingMallAiProduct.IUpdate structure, which includes fields like title, description, category, price, status, and SKU.

The updated product is returned upon success, including all core fields and updated timestamps. The endpoint enforces all foreign key relationships (category, seller association) and unique SKU constraints at the database level. Attempts to violate referential or business rules will result in errors. Proper audit logging and normalization are applied on update.

specification: Deletes a product from the catalog by product ID. This endpoint operates on the shopping_mall_ai_products table and will remove the specified row. If the schema only supports hard deletion (no deleted_at column), it performs a hard delete and the product is no longer retrievable. Only users with seller or admin privileges, who are also the product's owner or superusers, can access this endpoint. Product removal is strictly audited, and any related integrity constraints (e.g. for inventory, orders) are enforced by the backend logic or cascades.
description:
Removes a product identified by product ID from the product catalog (shopping_mall_ai_products table). In the current schema, where no soft-deletion field exists, this operation will perform a hard delete—fully erasing product data unless there are cascade protections or business rule constraints.

Only the owning seller and platform-level admins may perform this operation. Audit logs are created for all delete actions. If the product is linked to active orders or inventory, referential integrity checks may block deletion unless those dependencies are first handled or cascade-delete logic is present.

Errors occur if the product does not exist, the user lacks permission, or referential integrity is violated. All delete actions are final and irreversible in a hard-delete model.
summary: Delete a product permanently by ID (shopping_mall_ai_products, hard delete).

parameters.name: shoppingMallAiProductId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the product to delete.

specification: This operation retrieves a paginated list of product snapshot records from the shopping_mall_ai_product_snapshots table. Each record represents a versioned state of a product at a specific point in time, including the action (created, updated, deleted) and the full serialized product JSON. The operation supports audit requirements and allows for filtering and paginated access to product history for compliance monitoring, rollback proposals, or product change analytics. It is essential for both administrative and analytics users to query historical product changes efficiently.

Each snapshot in the shopping_mall_ai_product_snapshots table captures the exact state and metadata of a product at a particular event (creation, update, deletion), maintaining an audit trail required for regulatory compliance.

Only authorized users, typically administrators, are permitted to access this historical changelog due to sensitive data and compliance audit requirements. Snapshots reveal serialized representations of product data, the triggering action, and timestamps. This operation also supports related tracking through product and seller relations for in-depth investigation.

Related operations include fetching snapshots for a specific product/product version, restoring a product state, or deleting an incorrect version. Error handling includes access denial for unauthorized roles and validation of filter/pagination arguments.

Searches can filter by session token, cart id, status, or last activity, and support pagination and sorting by recent activity or created time. Each session record links a device or ephemeral session token with a particular cart, as defined in the shopping_mall_ai_cart_sessions table. Administrative or support users use this endpoint to search by session token, cart ID, or last activity in order to support cart recovery or analyze abandonment rates. Filters and pagination allow operational scalability and privacy-sensitive investigation into user flows. Direct access to session tokens and IPs must be tightly restricted to admins, in line with compliance practices and audit requirements described in the schema.

The operation integrates with broader support tooling, such as viewing customer cart contents, identifying abandoned carts for campaigns, and aggregating cart statistics for KPI dashboards. It is not intended for routine customer-facing use, but for internal analytics, compliance, and operational investigation workflows.

The endpoint is intended for internal dashboards, operational review, or compliance audits—never open customer UIs—so it rigorously enforces RBAC to permit access only by admins or authorized auditors.

Typically used in workflows that require drilling down into order flow, escalations, anomaly investigations, or support cases, in combination with other endpoints for linked records (order items, payments, shipments). Field access controls must strictly hide any fields not present in the schema or not allowed by business/role constraints.

As the schema lacks any soft-delete/deleted_at fields, this operation permanently deletes the order from storage. Normal business flows (user-initiated cancel/return) must not utilize this endpoint, which is RESTRICTED to admin or compliance actors.

All removals must be logged and tracked for future audit, and business/analytic processes referencing the order may need to handle possible missing records. Calling this operation can impact fulfillment, accounting, and support flows. RBAC enforcement ensures only administrators or legal/compliance services can call this operation, with no customer/seller access.

specification: Retrieves all order item records associated with a specific order in the shopping_mall_ai_orders table. The operation references the shopping_mall_ai_order_items table, providing a way to list the detailed items (SKUs, options, quantity, and status) that make up a given order. Results are paginated and can be filtered for status or item-level properties. This adheres to requirements for granular auditability and supports use cases such as customer history display, seller fulfillment, and admin order review. The operation ensures that only authorized roles can access order item details and that results do not expose more data than necessary based on caller's permissions.
description:
This API retrieves a paginated list of all order items that belong to a specified order, as stored in the shopping_mall_ai_order_items table. Each order item record includes product references, option information for variants, quantity, price at purchase, current item status (e.g., active, returned), and timestamps for audit and inventory reconciliation. Sensitive item-level details are only disclosed to users meeting appropriate access criteria, such as the order's owner (customer), the corresponding seller, or admin. Read access is logged for compliance, fulfilling regulatory transparency and retail audit requirements.

The endpoint supports role-based access controls. Admins and authorized sellers may retrieve order items for operational purposes, while customers may only access their own orders. Business logic ensures referential integrity, only returning items that are validly linked to the given order. Pagination and optional filters (e.g., by item status) support efficient navigation for both API consumers and retail UI implementations.

If an invalid or unauthorized orderId is supplied, the API returns appropriate error responses with minimal information disclosure. The operation aligns with the auditability, traceability, and performance requirements specified in business and compliance documentation.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the target order.

responseBody.description: Paginated list of order items for a given order.

specification: Enables advanced, filtered retrieval of order items for a specific order, supporting granular search, pagination, and sorting over shopping_mall_ai_order_items associated with the orderId in the path. Uses a request body for complex queries—filtering by item status, product ID, SKU, or creation timestamp, with full compliance to reporting and informational needs of sellers, admins, or owning customers. Provides a paginated response for scalable handling of large orders and aligns with requirements for flexible business intelligence and large order analytics.
description:
This operation powers complex, paginated searches and filtered retrieval of order items within a particular order. The search may incorporate multi-keyword, field-based, or status-specific filtering—such as locating items by SKU, status (e.g., returned, fulfilled), price range, or specific product options—while maintaining strict linkage to the provided orderId (from shopping_mall_ai_orders).

The request body accepts a search and filter object (IShoppingOrderItem.IRequest) that supports specifying criteria for precise reporting or dashboard needs. The endpoint supports robust pagination and sorting, needed for orders with many items or during administrative reviews. Role-based checks prevent unauthorized user access, and responses contain only those items the calling role is permitted to view. Returns a paginated list of detailed order item records, formatted for downstream BI, fulfillment, or service consumption.

Compliance, performance, and audit requirements are addressed by logging search access and enforcing granular permission checks during query execution.

specification: Retrieves details for a single order item, identified by orderId and orderItemId, from the shopping_mall_ai_order_items table. The operation returns all item-level fields including product, variant (option), quantity, price at time of purchase, current status, and audit timestamps. Role-based access ensures only authorized customers (order owners), relevant sellers (by product sold), or admins can access the specific order item. This aligns with compliance and audit requirements for reviewing sales, investigating fulfillment status, and handling customer service inquiries.
description:
This API returns all available information for a single order item record associated with a specific order, using both orderId and orderItemId as path parameters. Data is retrieved from the shopping_mall_ai_order_items table and includes product references, SKU/variant, item price and quantity, status (active, returned, etc.), and creation/update times. Detailed view access is limited to authorized actors as defined by the requirements for secure retail operation.

Audit logs record access to sensitive sales and tracking data, and roles are enforced strictly. Admins and sellers may access any item connected to orders they fulfill/supervise, while customers may only access their own order's items. Error responses include insufficient permissions or nonexistent item, with minimal disclosure on failure to meet security requirements. The operation supports core business functions in order review, dispute resolution, and operational analytics.

parameters.description: ID of the order containing the item.

parameters.description: ID of the target order item.

specification: Creates (atomically) a new order item within an existing order, writing to shopping_mall_ai_order_items. This endpoint implements business rules for item addition to orders—typically only available during fulfillment operations, post-processing corrections by admins, or in legacy system migrations. Payload must include all required atomic fields (product, option if present, quantity, price, and status). All referential integrity and permission checks are strictly enforced; customers generally should not use this endpoint except via system interfaces.
description:
This endpoint allows creation of a new order item under a given orderId. The required payload (IShoppingOrderItem.ICreate) must contain all atomic item fields such as product reference, optional variant/option, unit price, quantity, and initial item status. The endpoint checks referential integrity (orderId and productId must exist, links must match order context). Only authorized system actors (typically admin, or seller in fulfillment error scenarios) may use this endpoint—customer direct use is typically not permitted.

Business logic checks for duplicate item entries, enforces item-level constraints, and records all item creation for audit and compliance purposes. Successful requests return the fully instantiated order item object, including system-generated fields such as timestamps. On error, validation messages provide actionable feedback for correction.

parameters.description: Order ID where the new item will be created.

requestBody.description: Details for the new order item to be created.

responseBody.description: Created order item record for the order.

specification: Updates an existing order item identified by orderId and orderItemId, allowing changes to atomic fields such as status (for returns/exchanges), quantity, or price adjustments. Operates on shopping_mall_ai_order_items, enforcing business and audit rules for retail order management. Only authorized staff (admin) or the order's seller can perform updates; all others are denied. Full validation is performed on update payloads to prevent data inconsistency or improper modification of item history.
description:
This endpoint allows precise update of an existing order item within a specific order. Supported changes include altering item status (e.g., marking returned, exchanged), correcting price or quantity (as business policies allow), or updating variant references. Operates on shopping_mall_ai_order_items and enforces referential and business logic (admin/seller permission). Customers cannot update order items.

All updates are tracked in audit logs for compliance and traceability, with before/after states preserved. The payload (IShoppingOrderItem.IUpdate) defines allowable updatable fields corresponding to the atomic fields in the schema. Any attempt to modify immutable or forbidden fields (e.g., changing order linkage) will result in a validation error. On success, the endpoint returns the updated order item record.

specification: Deletes (hard delete - no soft delete fields in schema) an order item identified by orderId and orderItemId from shopping_mall_ai_order_items. Access restricted to system admin or seller managing fulfillment. Immediate deletion removes the item from the order and from auditable records (beyond logs retained by system), enforcing business logic for return/cancel scenarios and correcting error states. Customers are not permitted to delete order items directly.
description:
This API erases a specified order item from a given order using a hard delete (row removal) process, since the underlying schema does not include deleted_at or other soft deletion fields. Only admin or the seller with rights to the affected order may invoke this operation; customer initiation is not supported. Typical use cases include order correction (admin override), returns that remove order items entirely, or error resolution within fulfillment operations.

Proper referential integrity is enforced, and all delete operations are logged for compliance. Response codes differentiate between successful erasure and scenarios where deletion is forbidden due to immutable order states (completed orders, regulatory lock). No content is returned on successful hard delete; errors are returned for invalid requests.

parameters.description: Parent order ID for the item to delete.

parameters.description: ID of the order item to delete.

specification: Lists all payment records associated with a specific orderId, as recorded in shopping_mall_ai_payments. Implements financial reporting, reconciliation, and order status audit requirements. Resulting data includes payment method, status, timeline details, and amounts broken down for the order. Paginated for bulk orders or multi-method payment scenarios. Access granted to order owner, the seller, and administrators for review, dispute, and compliance tasks. Data returned supports dashboards and order status UIs.
description:
Fetches a paginated list of all payment events recorded for a specific order, referencing the shopping_mall_ai_payments table. Each entry details method (e.g., card, deposit), status (pending, successful, failed, refunded), amount, and timestamps for audit. Order-level financials are only available to relevant users (the customer who owns the order, the seller, or admins), with strict RBAC enforcement and audit logging.

Enables audit trails for financial history, multi-method payment support, refunds, and compliance review. The data structure is optimized for dashboard, BI export, and after-sales workflow support, and complies with platform-wide financial reporting requirements.

specification: Creates a new payment record linked to an existing order (shopping_mall_ai_payments), used for multi-method or corrective payment capture, refunds, or payment channel reconciliation. Payload defines atomic payment fields such as amount, method, initiated/resolved timestamps, status, and channel. Admin or seller fulfillment staff use this for manual record creation or reconciliation with external systems. Strict validation and referential integrity are enforced.
description:
This endpoint inserts a new payment event for a specified order. The payload (IShoppingPayment.ICreate) requires atomic payment details: payment method (e.g., card, deposit), amount, status, timestamps for initiation (and optionally resolution), and payment channel context. OrderId (from path) must reference an existing order. The endpoint is used by fulfillment, admin, or reconciliation workflows—customers typically do not invoke directly.

Business logic checks for multi-method usage, matches payment sums to order totals, and ensures integrity for reconciliation and compliance. Created records support audit trails, downstream financial reporting, and refund mechanics.

Returns the full payment object after successful creation, including all system-generated fields. Errors are returned for validation or permission failures.

specification: Updates a specific payment entry within an order, identified by orderId and paymentId, in the shopping_mall_ai_payments table. Allows modification of status, timestamps, amount, or payment method, as allowed by business rules and to support real-world scenarios such as refunds, payment error correction, or resolution closure. Strict permission checks—admins and responsible sellers only. All changes logged for compliance and audit records.
description: Modifies atomic fields of a payment record for an order, supporting business and operational needs such as correcting status, updating payment method information, recording refunds, or resolving payments after initial failures. Only allowed roles (admin or responsible seller) can call this endpoint—customers cannot edit payment records. Payload (IShoppingPayment.IUpdate) mirrors payment record atomic fields, with referential checks to prevent cross-order or cross-channel errors. On update, audit logs record before/after state for compliance. Successful response returns the full updated payment record; errors result in explicit messages for validation or permission failure.

specification: Deletes (hard delete only; no soft delete fields in schema) a payment record linked to an order by orderId and paymentId. Used for admin/seller error recovery, voids, or reconciliation corrections. Hard deletion removes record from downstream reporting and financial audits. Strictly limited to admins (preferred) or responsible sellers. All actions fully logged for compliance retention. Response is void on success, and error codes are issued for forbidden or failed deletion attempts.
description:
This endpoint permanently deletes a specified payment record from an order, using a hard delete operation since no soft-delete fields exist in shopping_mall_ai_payments. Admin or the seller responsible for the payment may perform this if business rules permit (e.g., voided erroneous payment, corrected record after manual reconciliation). Successful invocation removes the record and cascades changes to downstream analytics/reporting. All actions are tracked in audit logs for future compliance or financial review.

The endpoint will return errors for unauthorized access, attempts to delete immutable payment records, or referential integrity violations. No message is returned on successful erasure; the operation is strictly destructive per compliance design.

name: erase

specification:
Retrieves the list of shipment records associated with a specific order. This operation uses the shopping_mall_ai_shipments table, which contains details of all shipping transactions for a given order, including current status, tracking number, provider, and audit timestamps. Each shipment entity is tied to a parent order by the orderId parameter, enabling clients to view all shipment events (e.g., partial shipments, reshipments) linked to a single order. This endpoint is crucial for end-users and support staff to monitor the logistics process, track packages, and resolve delivery issues.

The operation enforces RBAC according to the owner or administrator role: a customer may obtain shipment info for their own order, while sellers/admins may retrieve shipments for orders under their responsibility. All access is subject to security checks defined by actor role and order/shipment relationships. Audit trails and error logging are built in for compliance.

The endpoint response provides detailed shipment information as persisted in the database.
description:
Fetch a list of all shipment records associated with a given order. This endpoint references the shopping_mall_ai_shipments table to extract every shipment event tied to the specified order, identified by orderId. The returned data includes shipping states, tracking numbers, provider names when present, and audit timestamps for each shipment record.

Security: Only actors allowed by RBAC matrix (customer: their order; seller: their fulfilled orders; admin: all) can query this endpoint. Unauthorized queries result in RBAC error.

Data Integrity: Pulls direct data from the shopping_mall_ai_shipments table, ensuring accuracy. Linked product or order data must be obtained via related endpoints. Returns empty list if no shipments exist.

Related APIs: For shipment detail view, use the endpoint with an added {shipmentId} parameter. For updating, use the corresponding PUT operation.

Errors: Invalid orderId, authorization violations, or system failures will result in relevant error codes and messages.
summary: List all shipments for a specific order (shopping_mall_ai_shipments table)

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the target order whose shipments are to be listed.

responseBody.description: Array of shipments tied to the given orderId.

Allows filtered and paginated search of shipment records tied to a specific order using advanced search options. Leverages the shopping_mall_ai_shipments table and supports filtering, sorting, and pagination by shipment status, provider, date, and other attributes as defined in the schema.

This endpoint fulfills requirements for logistics staff, customers, and sellers to efficiently browse shipment histories, search for specific status updates, and audit partial or multi-shipment fulfillment patterns for compliance and customer service. The orderId parameter anchors the scope to a single order.

Security and access are enforced per-user role; only eligible users may query according to RBAC and ownership constraints. The request body must conform to the search DTO, while the response provides paginated data with all shipment details needed for operational review and user display.
description:
Provides advanced search and pagination over the list of shipments assigned to the given order. Using the orderId path parameter to restrict the search scope, this endpoint calls the shopping_mall_ai_shipments table matching shipmentStatus, provider, creation time, or other allowed filters as set in the IRequest DTO. Sorting and limit/offset or cursor-based pagination are supported, following standard search patterns.

Only the order owner, assigned seller, or platform admin may invoke this API. Detailed query options are designed for contact center operators as well as customers checking specific shipment events.

Paginated output ensures clients can manage orders with dozens of shipment events effectively without retrieving all at once. The underlying request DTO must match the current shipment search schema, tied to audit and compliance reporting for all search operations.

specification:
Retrieves detailed information for a single shipment related to the specified order. This operation interacts with the shopping_mall_ai_shipments table, identified by both orderId and shipmentId, to guarantee that only shipments bound to the given order can be accessed through this endpoint.

This endpoint is designed for logistics dashboards, customer self-service, and admin audit where full detail—status, tracking, provider, and audit information—are required for the precise shipment, not the whole list. Data returned is complete for that shipment record, enabling display or further processing/verification.

The operation is protected by RBAC: only order owner, assigned seller, or admin can access the endpoint for the correct shipmentId/orderId pairing. Data errors (invalid IDs, mismatched references) yield not-found or forbidden errors.
description:
Get complete detail for a specific shipment associated with an order. The combination of orderId (parent order) and shipmentId (child shipment) is used to identify and fetch the shipment record. The returned payload presents full shipment metadata as stored in the shopping_mall_ai_shipments table, including status, tracking information, provider (if available), and all timestamped audit fields.

Security enforces access by order owner, assigned seller, or platform admins only. If the IDs do not match a real shipment, or user is not authorized, the response will signal error or authorization denied. Use for detailed shipment view screens, or support investigations.

Recommended to use after listing all shipments for an order, or for programmatically examining a single shipment in logistics workflows.

parameters.description: Order to which the shipment belongs.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the shipment to retrieve.

responseBody.description: Complete shipment detail object for the indicated shipment.

specification:
Retrieves detailed information for a single shipment related to the specified order. This operation interacts with the shopping_mall_ai_shipments table, identified by both orderId and shipmentId, to guarantee that only shipments bound to the given order can be accessed through this endpoint.

This endpoint is designed for logistics dashboards, customer self-service, and admin audit where full detail—status, tracking, provider, and audit information—are required for the precise shipment, not the whole list. Data returned is complete for that shipment record, enabling display or further processing/verification.

The operation is protected by RBAC: only order owner, assigned seller, or admin can access the endpoint for the correct shipmentId/orderId pairing. Data errors (invalid IDs, mismatched references) yield not-found or forbidden errors.
description:
Get complete detail for a specific shipment associated with an order. The combination of orderId (parent order) and shipmentId (child shipment) is used to identify and fetch the shipment record. The returned payload presents full shipment metadata as stored in the shopping_mall_ai_shipments table, including status, tracking information, provider (if available), and all timestamped audit fields.

Security enforces access by order owner, assigned seller, or platform admins only. If the IDs do not match a real shipment, or user is not authorized, the response will signal error or authorization denied. Use for detailed shipment view screens, or support investigations.

Recommended to use after listing all shipments for an order, or for programmatically examining a single shipment in logistics workflows.
summary: Fetch detail of a single order shipment by ID (shopping_mall_ai_shipments table)

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Order to which the shipment belongs.

parameters.name: shipmentId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the shipment to retrieve.

responseBody.description: Complete shipment detail object for the indicated shipment.

name: at

specification:
Creates a new shipment record for a particular order, using fields such as status, tracking number, provider, and timestamps as defined in the shopping_mall_ai_shipments table. This supports logistics event tracking, split shipments, order fulfillment, and legal compliance (audit trail/resource tracking). The orderId parameter connects the new shipment atomically to its parent order.

This endpoint enforces that only authorized sellers or administrators can add shipments for an order, supporting platform policies for fulfillment and operational logistics. All inputs are validated strictly per schema; records are written with full audit fields for regulatory and customer transparency. If the order does not exist or the actor lacks access privileges, the endpoint signals errors accordingly.

Intended for use in warehouse, seller dashboard, or admin logistics tools.
description:
Register a new shipment event under a target order. The orderId path parameter specifies the parent order to associate with this shipment. The shipment data, including status (pending, shipped, delivered), tracking code, optional provider, and relevant timestamps as required by schema, must be provided in the request body DTO.

RBAC controls limit creating shipments to responsible sellers and administrators. Customers cannot register shipments. All field validations follow the shopping_mall_ai_shipments schema, and each shipment is audit-logged upon creation. Used in logistics UIs and automated order-splitting/fulfillment processes.

Returns the entire created shipment record for confirmation or further processing. Related APIs include PATCH for searching/checking shipment status, and GET for listing all shipments for the order.
summary: Create a new shipment for an order (shopping_mall_ai_shipments table)

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: ID of the order for which shipment is being created.

requestBody.description: Fields for new shipment registration (status, tracking, etc.).

responseBody.description: Created shipment data as persisted in database.

specification:
Updates an existing shipment record with new state, tracking, or provider info. This endpoint uses the shopping_mall_ai_shipments table, identified by orderId (parent) and shipmentId (shipment record), to guarantee updates are scoped to the correct order. The request body follows IUpdate schema for shipments, and all business and audit validations are enforced (e.g., status transitions, timestamp handling).

The operation is critical for logistics staff and sellers to correct or progress shipment workflows, e.g., moving from shipped to delivered, or to add late tracking codes/providers. Strict RBAC restricts update rights to trusted sellers (of the order) and administrators. Update attempts on deleted or mismatched shipments yield errors.
description:
Modify a shipment already linked to an order. Use orderId (parent) and shipmentId (target child) to specify which shipment to update. Accepts fields such as status, tracking, provider, or audit fields as defined by the IUpdate DTO for the shipment object.

Authorization is enforced so only the correct seller or admin can make modifications—customers cannot alter shipments. Uses atomic validation to prevent order-shipment scoping mismatches. All changes are audit-logged by the platform for compliance and investigation support. Returns updated record for confirmation.
summary: Update a shipment for a given order (shopping_mall_ai_shipments table)

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Order which the shipment belongs to.

parameters.name: shipmentId
parameters.description: ID of the shipment being updated.

requestBody.description: Update DTO fields to modify shipment.

responseBody.description: Updated shipment object as persisted in storage.

name: update

specification:
Deletes (permanently removes) a shipment record from the shopping_mall_ai_shipments table, scoped under a given order ID, using primary keys for both order and shipment (shipmentId). As the schema does not include a soft delete (no deleted_at field), this operation performs a hard delete.

This API is strictly reserved for administrators and authorized sellers due to compliance and traceability. Typical use cases include invalid shipment recording by mistake, compliance takedowns, or order fix workflows. Deletion is audit-logged for investigation and legal compliance.

All security and RBAC policies are enforced at operation time, and attempts on non-existent or unauthorized records yield error responses.
description:
Erase (hard delete) a shipment tied to a specific order by exact record identity (orderId + shipmentId). No soft deletion is present, so the database row is removed. Used in admin or high-trust seller support tools to resolve invalid shipments or operational errors.

Security & Authorization: Only permitted for trusted actors as enforced by RBAC, with full audit logging. Customers cannot call this endpoint. Related shipment GET endpoints should be used for validation before deletion. Operation is irreversible.
summary: Delete a shipment (hard delete) by ID (shopping_mall_ai_shipments table)

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Order parent of the shipment being deleted.

parameters.name: shipmentId
parameters.description: Shipment record to remove.

name: erase

specification:
Lists all available coupons in the platform, using the shopping_mall_ai_coupons table. This endpoint returns system, seller, and product-level coupons regardless of status, with details necessary for customers (for redemption), sellers (management), and admins (oversight and auditing).

The returned data set may be filtered by coupon status, validity, type, and issuer (role-authorized). Uses DTO summary type for minimal response—aids performance for large coupon sets, with optional links to details. Audit controls built in for access tracking.
description:
Fetch a list of all coupon records in the shopping mall system for the caller's visibility scope. The endpoint returns individual coupon objects as summary data based on the shopping_mall_ai_coupons table, supporting both platform and seller-issued coupons. Fields include code, type, value, applicable status, and core audit fields such as creation and update time.

Accessible to all authenticated actors by RBAC role: customers view available/valid coupons, sellers view their issued coupons, admins may view/manage all. List can be sorted, filtered, or paginated in consumer. Use PATCH for advanced search, and POST to create coupons (with proper permissions).

Error handling: Unauthorized or out-of-scope requests will return security violation errors. No sensitive customer data is leaked in summary.
summary: List all coupons in system or for role (shopping_mall_ai_coupons table)

responseBody.description: Summary list of coupons for all allowed actors.

specification:
Enables advanced, paginated search/filter of coupons using the shopping_mall_ai_coupons table. Supports searching by code, type, status, validity window, and issuer, plus sorting and pagination via the IRequest DTO criteria. This allows sellers, admins, or customers to find coupons relevant for redemption or management tasks efficiently.

This endpoint addresses the business need for fast coupon discovery in busy systems and supports audit and compliance checks for special campaign or fraud review. Access is controlled by RBAC to limit visibility and scope to the requesting actor's allowed coupons.
description:
Activates multi-dimensional search for coupon records, including fields like code, status, validity, and type. The provided IRequest DTO in the request body carries all filter, sorting, and pagination parameters for an advanced search. Matching coupons are returned as a paginated response, showing details suitable for both listing and selection, with compliance to the RBAC matrix for scope limitation by actor role.

Useful for dashboards, campaign review, or advanced coupon analytics. Unauthorized roles or filters outside permitted fields will result in denied or filtered results.

Page structure allows for efficient fetch from very large coupon datasets.
summary: Search/paginate coupons by multi-dimensional criteria (shopping_mall_ai_coupons table)

requestBody.description: Search, filter, sort, and pagination rules for coupon search.

responseBody.description: Paginated, filtered list of matching coupon summaries.

specification:
Provides full, detailed information for a single coupon, identified by the unique couponId, using the shopping_mall_ai_coupons table. All coupon metadata required for redemption, restrictions, status, value, type, and linkage to issuer (seller/channel/product) are returned for the specified coupon.

This operation is required for coupon detail view screens, campaign analysis, auditing, or redemption eligibility logic. Strict RBAC ensures only authorized actors may view the coupon information, with elevated privileges needed for non-public or administrative coupons. Response always reflects the current database record.
description:
Fetches complete details for a specific coupon identified by couponId from the shopping_mall_ai_coupons table. Includes all core coupon fields: code, type, value, min/max usage rules, validity, issuer and scope, and audit timestamps. Nullable relation fields such as channel, seller, or product will be included where present.

Most often called as the detail view after using GET or PATCH listing endpoints. Security checks apply to prevent exposure of sensitive coupons outside the actor's scope (e.g., sellers/admins vs. users). Related endpoints enable update or deletion (admin/seller only).
summary: Get full detail of a coupon by ID (shopping_mall_ai_coupons table)

parameters.name: couponId
parameters.description: Unique coupon identifier to retrieve.

responseBody.description: Complete coupon object as stored in DB, all fields.

specification:
Creates a new coupon in the system via the shopping_mall_ai_coupons table. The request body follows the coupon creation schema and supports all coupon types: fixed, percent, seller- or admin-issued, channel/product/global. Input fields enforce business rules for uniqueness, value, validity, and permissions. Results in a new, uniquely code-identified coupon.

Only sellers and admins can issue new coupons, and only within their platform-scope authority. Coupon is persisted immediately and audit-logged for fraud and campaign control. Access violations and validation failures will result in error codes.
description:
Registers a new coupon into the system using the shopping_mall_ai_coupons table and the ICreate DTO. Allowed only for authorized sellers and administrators. All coupon fields (issuer, code, type, value, scope, validity, stacking, use caps) must meet current business validation and rules as defined in schema and requirements. Results in audit-logged persistence of new coupon, error on business rule or RBAC violation.

Created coupon object is returned for confirmation and further processing, with proper RBAC scoping.

requestBody.description: Coupon creation fields per schema (code, type, value, validity, etc.)

responseBody.description: Created coupon as persisted in storage.

specification:
Updates an existing coupon using the shopping_mall_ai_coupons table and the couponId identifier. Modifiable fields (per schema and business policy) include value, validity period, max/min caps, and status. Not all fields may be updated after coupon creation (e.g., code is typically immutable), following audit rules and compliance requirements.

Operation is allowed only for authorized sellers and administrators. All schema/business/POS validation is enforced. Results in updated coupon entity persisted in DB, audit-logged for fraud or error tracking. Unauthorized or non-existent couponId yields error.
description:
Modifies the details of an existing coupon by unique ID, using the update DTO to provide new values where allowed (value, status, expiration, max caps, etc.). Covers seller- and admin-issued coupons. Changes are persisted atomically and fully audit-logged as per compliance requirements. Only owner issuer or admin (platform-wide) can update a coupon; customers/users may not.

Success response includes updated coupon object for confirmation. Invalid couponId or RBAC role returns authorization or not-found error.

specification:
Deletes a coupon from the shopping_mall_ai_coupons table by its unique couponId. Since there is no "deleted_at" field in the schema, deletes are hard and result in permanent removal from the database. Permitted only for issuer (seller) or admin by RBAC matrix for audit and fraud prevention or campaign error correction.

Operation performs a hard delete, with full audit-logging for compliance. Customers cannot invoke; non-existent or unauthorized resources yield a not-found or permission error.
description: Erases (hard deletes) a coupon by unique ID. Admin or issuer action only; customers cannot use this endpoint. The deletion is permanent due to lack of soft delete field in shopping_mall_ai_coupons schema. Used for post-campaign clean-up or fraud remediation. All deletes are audit-logged for compliance investigation.
summary: Delete a coupon (hard delete) by ID (shopping_mall_ai_coupons table)

parameters.name: couponId
parameters.description: Coupon to permanently remove.

This endpoint is used for administrative review, audit, and customer service purposes, as well as for analytics on user engagement and loyalty program effectiveness.

It provides a read-only overview for admins and compliance teams. Security considerations include restricting access to authorized roles, protecting detailed fields, and preventing exposure of sensitive analytics to unauthorized users. Pagination and sorting are implemented to allow review of high-volume points data efficiently. This API may be used in conjunction with customer detail or loyalty event endpoints for holistic analysis. Error handling ensures that any database or permission issues are reported with actionable messaging.

Retrieve a paginated, sortable list of all loyalty mileage point events for customers in the system. This includes all events involving earning, redeeming, or administrative adjustment of points. The event data is atomic and auditable, and each record is suitable for reporting or review.

Access is restricted to admin roles or delegated customer care agents with sufficient permissions. Sensitive audit fields are never exposed to lower-privilege roles. The endpoint supports pagination and can be extended for future filters. Integration with other customer or loyalty event endpoints is expected in advanced analytics workflows.

Any access control violations or database errors are logged for compliance investigation. The return data matches the mileage_points schema, summing to a comprehensive platform-wide view of virtual currency flow.

Sensitive fields are only available to authorized admin or system roles to ensure privacy and audit security. This endpoint is typically used alongside customer detail lookups or as a drill-down from a summary view. If the event does not exist, a clear not-found error is returned.

Event creation is strictly controlled to ensure accurate points ledgers and prevent abuse/fraud.

Role-based authorization ensures that only admins or designated system roles may issue, redeem, or adjust points manually. Input validation enforces schema rules and cross-references users, amounts, and business conditions. This API must be used in conjunction with customer and loyalty module audits for full compliance. Any disputes or errors are audit-logged via this event table for regulatory traceability. The response returns the full detail for the newly created event. Business rules and schema constraints are strictly enforced.

Only high-privilege roles may call this endpoint, and every invocation is logged for compliance. Robust input validation ensures integrity of the loyalty points ledger and may include business-rule checks (e.g., allowed adjustment sizes). Response is the fully qualified record for the created event. This API is fundamental to all loyalty points workflows, including post-purchase credits and promotional awards. Acts on shopping_mall_ai_mileage_points. Access is limited to admins or designated system operators. All updates are strictly validated and logged, and may trigger additional audit logs or compliance notifications if used to resolve critical errors or conflicts. All deletions must be logged and strictly authorized, as this impacts the historic loyalty currency ledger.

The operation checks for the existence of the mileage event and applies only if the record exists. Only admin or specially privileged roles may perform deletes. The operation does not return the deleted record but may provide confirmation. Compliance and regulatory requirements demand strict audit trace of this deletion action.

All deletion actions are audit logged at the compliance layer. Any attempt to delete a non-existent record returns a clearly documented error. Post-delete, the points ledger will not include the deleted event for analytics or audit. The action is irreversible and must be used with caution in real-world deployments.

specification:
Retrieve a paginated list of loyalty-related events for all customers, typically for audit or loyalty program management. Based on the shopping_mall_ai_loyalty_events table, this endpoint returns atomic and auditable events such as awarded, redeemed, expired, revoked, or reviewed loyalty actions. Each event includes the customer, event type, points (if any), details, actor (admin or seller, possibly null), and timestamp.

This API is used by admin and loyalty program operators for reviewing global loyalty actions, compliance events, and rollback investigations. It supports sorting and pagination for high-volume data scenarios. Access is restricted to admins and audit personnel. Pagination parameters allow scalable review of loyalty event flows across the entire platform.
description:
Fetch a paginated listing of all loyalty events performed for customers, such as points awards, redemptions, expiries, revocations, and admin reviews. Each event is an atomic record suitable for compliance and program analytics.

This endpoint is only available to admin/audit roles. The API is optimized for high-throughput environments and ensures that only the necessary fields per the schema are included. Used for regulatory reporting, loyalty program health checks, and investigating customer incentive histories. Database or permission errors are reported in clear, actionable terms.
summary: List all loyalty events for audit, compliance, and admin review (Promotions/Loyalty schema).

responseBody.description: Paginated list of loyalty event records for compliance, audit, and reporting analysis.

name: index

specification:
This endpoint enables flexible search, filtering, and reporting on the loyalty events ledger for all customers. It is built on the shopping_mall_ai_loyalty_events table and allows filtering by customer, event type, date, points, actor, and more using a complex request body—particularly useful for admin dashboards, compliance checks, or loyalty program optimization analysis.

Role-based access ensures that only privileged users (admin/audit) can execute this advanced search. Input is strictly validated and responses are always paginated to manage large data sets. This endpoint is often used together with customer analytics or for regulatory export filtering.

Ensures strict alignment with schema and business rules for Loyalty Events.
description:
Perform an advanced search for loyalty events across the audit ledger, supporting filters such as customer, event type (awarded, redeemed, expired, etc.), points, occurred_at range, or assigned admin/seller actor. The result is always a paginated set optimized for admin-side dashboards, analytics, or compliance review.

Access is reserved to admin or compliance teams. This PATCH endpoint allows richer query inputs than a GET, supporting higher complexity and flexibility for platform operators. All search actions are logged for subsequent audit, and misuse triggers clear error or compliance notification. Related endpoints include the detailed event or customer drill-down APIs.
summary: Advanced search/reporting for loyalty events (for dashboards/compliance, Promotions schema).

requestBody.description: Loyalty event search filter, allowing complex queries by customer, actor, event type, range, points, etc.

responseBody.description: Paginated filtered result for loyalty event records matching administrator queries.

name: search

specification:
Retrieve a detailed view of a single loyalty event for a customer, as referenced by its UUID in the shopping_mall_ai_loyalty_events table. Returns full event audit data: customer, event type, points (if relevant), involved actor (admin/seller), timestamp, and details. Used for regulatory or compliance checks and for customer care investigations into specific incidents.

Access is strictly limited to high-privilege roles. Any absent, missing, or deleted record will return a standardized not-found error in line with compliance logging. This granularity is critical to regulatory and customer complaint investigations.
description:
Fetch details for a specific loyalty event from the ledger by ID. The response includes all audit-required fields as defined in the schema, such as customer, event type, points, notes, involved actors, and timestamp. This is only available to admin or audit roles.

The endpoint is used for drilldown in loyalty analytics dashboards and for resolving disputes. Each access is logged for compliance. Any attempt to retrieve a nonexistent or deleted loyalty event yields an error and a compliance audit log entry. Schema adherence is strictly enforced for response structure integrity.
summary: View details for single loyalty event (audit, compliance, dashboard use, Promotions schema).

parameters.name: loyaltyEventId
parameters.description: UUID of loyalty event for detailed inspection in audit, compliance, and program review.

responseBody.description: Full audit record and details for specified loyalty event.

name: at

specification:
This endpoint creates a new loyalty event for a customer, such as an award (upon purchase, event), redemption, expiry, admin override, or other loyalty-related action. It creates a new record in the shopping_mall_ai_loyalty_events table with all required audit information (customer ID, actor/admin/seller ID, event type, points, occurred_at, etc.).

Strictly for use by admin, operator, or system-privileged roles; creation is always audit logged and subject to validation rules and business constraints (e.g., point amount restrictions, valid event types). It operates as the canonical log for loyalty event changes, used for regulatory and financial system integration. The response returns the event as written to the ledger.
description:
Create a new loyalty/points event in the audit ledger, such as points award, redemption, expiry, review, or revocation. All audit fields (customer, actor/admin, event type, points, timestamp) are required and strictly validated.

Only administrative or privileged system actors can use this endpoint. Every transaction is audit logged to ensure regulatory and business policy compliance. The API is a foundation of loyalty module operations and critical for post-hoc analytic and regulatory review. Errors are detailed and compliance tracked.
summary: Create a new loyalty event (admin only, Promotions/Loyalty schema).

requestBody.description: Complete details for new loyalty event (customer, actor/admin, event type, points, etc.).

responseBody.description: Audit record for newly created loyalty event as written to the database.

name: create

specification:
Update a specific loyalty event by UUID, typically to reflect an admin correction, business policy rollback, or program adjustment. The PATCH method modifies shopping_mall_ai_loyalty_events records, updating point amounts, event types, or details as allowed within business rules. Operations are always audit logged and restricted to authorized users. If a given event ID is nonexistent, a not-found error and compliance log are generated.

This operation is required for the small number of cases where post-facto corrections are necessary and allowed by policy. The schema is authored to strictly reflect allowable changes. Full compliance with audit and integrity requirements is enforced.
description:
Update details of a single loyalty event to reflect audit corrections, loyalty policy changes, or approved administrative override. Typical edit fields include type, points, details, or actor. Used exclusively in rare business logic correction cases by admin or operators.

All updates are traceable for regulatory or compliance review, and only privileged users have access. Responds with the fully updated event. Errors/nonexistent records trigger compliance logs and detailed error feedback. Functionality supports programmatic loyalty policy change as well.
summary: Update an existing loyalty event (admin corrections, Promotions/Loyalty schema).

parameters.name: loyaltyEventId
parameters.description: UUID identity of the loyalty event record to update.

requestBody.description: Fields for loyalty event correction (type, points, actor/admin, notes, etc.).

responseBody.description: The loyalty event record after all permitted business or compliance updates.

name: update

specification:
Hard-deletes a specific loyalty event by UUID from the shopping_mall_ai_loyalty_events audit trail. Since the schema does not implement soft-deletion, this physically removes the event (for example, if fraudulent or in compliance with a legal directive). All delete actions are trace-auditable and must be strictly limited to privileged operators or compliance personnel. Deleted events are no longer available for reporting or analytics after execution.

Attempts to remove a non-existent record result in an explicit error and compliance log. Comprehensive permission checks guard against unauthorized deletions. As no soft delete field exists, the action is irreversible.
description:
Permanently delete (hard remove) a specific loyalty event from the ledger by UUID. Reserved for cases of proven fraud, administrative requirement, or compliance enforcement. Only highly privileged administrative users and compliance roles may perform this action.

All deletions are audit logged at the compliance layer, and the action is irreversible. The endpoint returns no content but a confirmation on successful removal. Nonexistent-target attempts generate clear error messages and audit entries. This operation completes the full CRUD set for loyalty event records within the schema constraints.
summary: Remove a loyalty event (hard delete, admin/compliance only, Promotions schema).

parameters.name: loyaltyEventId
parameters.description: UUID of event to be deleted from the loyalty audit ledger.

name: erase

specification: Retrieves a paginated list of BBS (bulletin board system) posts. This operation works on the shopping_mall_ai_bbs_posts table, providing users with the ability to view posts with optional parameters for filtering, sorting, and pagination. Each post contains information such as its title, body, creation time, author, and which channel/section it belongs to. The endpoint ensures content is shown only if not soft-deleted (where deleted_at is null). Useful for customers seeking community forum posts, general announcements, or searching bulletin boards. Role-based access ensures only active posts are visible based on user's channel and section context.
description:
Fetch a paginated list of BBS posts available in the shopping mall forum. Each post includes metadata such as title, content, author (linked to customer id), and timestamps for creation and updates. Only posts with deleted_at as null are considered visible. 

Customers can browse available forum posts, while sellers and admins may also use this endpoint for moderation review. Security is ensured by enforcing that only authenticated users can view collection results and that the posts are returned per channel or section context as set by user roles and permissions.

Carefully implements requirements for content visibility, pagination, and filtering as defined in the shopping_mall_ai_bbs_posts schema. If severe error or permission violation occurs, appropriate error messages are returned.
summary: Get a paginated list of shopping mall BBS posts (shopping_mall_ai_bbs_posts)

responseBody.description: Paginated result set of BBS posts that are visible to the user.

specification: Performs a filtered and paginated search of BBS posts utilizing advanced query capabilities. Based on the shopping_mall_ai_bbs_posts table, this endpoint enables users and moderators to perform complex queries with criteria such as channel/section, author, creation time window, keywords, or active status. Supports access control so that only posts consistent with deletion and channel/section policy are visible. Implements support for bulk moderation review and advanced filtering for admin needs.
description:
Allows clients to query the BBS post collection with detailed filter parameters. Filtering options may include channel id, section id, customer id (author), free-text search on title/body, as well as date ranges for creation and update timestamps. Only non-deleted posts (deleted_at is null) are shown in results.

Admins and sellers may use this endpoint for moderation or analytics, while customers may search for posts relevant to their context (e.g., announcements, FAQs). Responds with paginated results and includes options for sorting and advanced filtering as permitted by the platform's business rules.

Integrates directly with the forum post table and supports rapid search for high-visibility or compliance purposes.

specification: Fetches detailed information for a single BBS post identified by its ID. References the shopping_mall_ai_bbs_posts table, returning the post data if it exists and is not soft-deleted (deleted_at is null). Exposes content details, author, forum relationships, and all relevant display metadata. Only accessible to users with permission to view the post in its channel/section context, with error returned if not found or access denied.
description:
Retrieve details of a specific shopping mall BBS post by its unique identifier. The operation returns all available properties for this post (title, body, author, timestamps, deletion status, etc.) as stored in the shopping_mall_ai_bbs_posts table. If the post has been soft-deleted (deleted_at is non-null), access is forbidden and a not-found error may be returned as per business logic.

Access control ensures customers, sellers, and admins only see posts belonging to their permitted channels and sections. Used frequently for post-detail views or navigation from search/listing endpoints.

Handles validation and error handling for incorrect identifiers, deleted posts, or insufficient permissions.

specification: Updates an existing BBS forum post in the shopping_mall_ai_bbs_posts table, given its unique ID. Only the post's author or an admin may perform updates, with all changes tracked for audit purposes. Supports editing title/body. Soft-deletion checks prevent modification of already deleted posts.
description:
Update an existing forum post in the shopping mall. Authenticated users, limited to the original author (customer) or an admin, may edit post content and metadata as permitted in the IShoppingMallAiBbsPost.IUpdate schema. The update is logged with an updated_at timestamp. If the post is deleted (deleted_at is non-null), update is forbidden with appropriate error.

Role-based access control ensures that only permitted users can modify posts in assigned channel or section contexts. Full audit trail (pre/post) is supported for compliance.

specification: Deletes (soft-deletes) a BBS forum post by its unique ID from the shopping_mall_ai_bbs_posts table. Sets the deleted_at timestamp (not a hard delete). Only permitted for the original post author or an admin. Records audit trail for compliance.
description:
Soft delete a BBS forum post using its unique identifier. Post is not permanently removed; instead, the deleted_at timestamp is set to the current time, ensuring full compliance with audit and retention policies of the shopping_mall_ai_bbs_posts schema. Only the original author or an admin is allowed to initiate deletion.

Deleted posts become invisible to regular users. If the post is already deleted or the user lacks permission, error states are returned accordingly. All delete operations are audited.
