Applicable to customers, sellers, admins for post engagement, moderation, or analytics. Returns threaded comment structures for use in client thread UIs. Honors permissions for content visibility and section/channel context.

Required fields and constraint rules are derived from shopping_mall_ai_bbs_comments schema, and audit context is recorded as appropriate.

Customers, sellers, and admins may write comments per role/context permission matrix. Fails with error if post does not exist, is deleted, or permission is denied.

Content editing is permitted but comment must not be soft-deleted. Full audit tracked for all changes. Works on shopping_mall_ai_bbs_comments.
description:
Update an existing comment within a BBS forum post thread by specifying both post and comment UUIDs. Permitted to the comment's author and administration staff only. Updates are tracked with updated_at. Attempts to update deleted comments (deleted_at non-null) or comments not belonging to the target post will error. Edits include content/body and possibly edit history as bounded by shopping_mall_ai_bbs_comments schema.

Implements strict permissions for editing, including role checks and hierarchical verification for parent/child comments. Used for correcting or updating posted comments in forum threads.

specification: Deletes (soft-deletes) a comment from a BBS thread using its UUID and parent post UUID. Soft-deletion is achieved by setting deleted_at (not hard delete). Only the author or an admin can delete. Ensures proper compliance and audit via shopping_mall_ai_bbs_comments schema.
description:
Soft delete a comment, given the parent BBS post UUID and the specific comment UUID. Deletes are performed by marking deleted_at to the current timestamp, maintaining full audit compliance according to shopping_mall_ai_bbs_comments. Only the comment's author or an admin is allowed to perform this operation; all actions are tracked for moderation review.

Results in the comment becoming invisible to regular users. If attempt is made on an already deleted comment or if user lacks permission, an error is returned.

specification: Retrieves a paginated list of product inquiries (Q&A) posted by customers and managed by sellers. This operation reads from the shopping_mall_ai_inquiries table, which stores one row per inquiry and tracks question, privacy, answer, participants, and audit timestamps. The API is designed for use cases such as customer dashboards, seller responses, and admin monitoring. Filtering and ordering should support typical Q&A workflows, but only simple list retrieval is performed here (for advanced search use PATCH). Related entities (product, customer, seller) are referenced by their IDs. Only non-deleted records are included by default, according to the business need for visibility and compliance. This endpoint supports both authenticated customers retrieving their own inquiries and admins/sellers viewing Q&A related to their products for rapid engagement and moderation.
description:
This endpoint retrieves a list of product inquiries (Q&A), supporting customer-seller communication and transparency. It utilizes the shopping_mall_ai_inquiries table, which records each inquiry's ID, linked product, involved customer and seller, the question body, privacy flag, answer, helpfulness state, timestamps for creation and answer, and soft deletion status.

Access to this API requires filtering depending on the caller’s role; customers see their own inquiries, sellers see questions related to their products, and admins can access all. Security best practices must be enforced based on the role, and privacy rules apply for is_private=true–such questions are only returned for the involved customer and assigned seller.

Business logic includes filtering out records with deleted_at set (except for admin-level exports or audits) and omitting answers to private inquiries for non-participants. Usage of this endpoint is common for in-app dashboards, customer self-service portals, and seller engagement panels. Error handling includes returning an empty list if no records are found, and proper authorization failure messages if the user role does not have access.
summary: Get a simple list of product inquiries (Q&A) from shopping_mall_ai_inquiries table.

responseBody.description: Array of product inquiries; see shopping_mall_ai_inquiries structure. Sensitive fields are filtered per access role and privacy flag.

specification: Searches, filters, and paginates the product inquiry (Q&A) data in shopping_mall_ai_inquiries for advanced use cases involving large-scale list retrieval, filtered queries, or complex business dashboards. This PATCH operation enables advanced filtering on product_id, customer_id, seller_id, is_private, answer status, and timestamp ranges. API is built for efficient dashboard, analytics, or operational support tooling. It processes request body parameters as IShoppingMallAiInquiry.IRequest for customizable, business-compliant queries.
description:
Provides advanced search, filter, and pagination on product inquiry records. The shopping_mall_ai_inquiries table fields (product, customer, seller, privacy, creation time, answer, status) are fully filterable, enabling tailored retrieval for customer and seller tools or admin support processes.

Request must be shaped according to IShoppingMallAiInquiry.IRequest, allowing complex filter structures, sort order, and page sizing. Authorization is enforced by user role; only relevant data is returned per role permissions, with privacy enforcement on is_private=true records. Admins may search all data, while sellers and customers get restricted results.

This operation is designed for dashboard scenarios, analytic exports, and operational workflows, supporting a variety of cross-role business tasks. Error responses are issued for unauthorized filters or invalid query structures.

specification: Retrieves specific product inquiry details by inquiryId from shopping_mall_ai_inquiries, returning all associated fields. description:
Allows a customer to create a new product inquiry question, recording it in the shopping_mall_ai_inquiries table. Required data includes product/seller/asker references, question body, and privacy setting.

Authorization must ensure the caller is an authenticated customer and may only create on their own behalf. Upon completion, triggers seller notifications for rapid response, and system audit logging. Timestamps are auto-generated; answer/marked_helpful fields are initially null. Validation ensures product exists, seller is valid, question is not empty, and privacy constraints are respected.

This endpoint supports the standard customer Q&A flow and is the first step in seller engagement or support escalation workflows.
summary: Create a new product inquiry (Q&A) question.

requestBody.description: Fields required to create a new inquiry (see IShoppingMallAiInquiry.ICreate).

responseBody.description: The newly created inquiry object including auto-generated fields and default nulls where appropriate. Follows IShoppingMallAiInquiry model.

name: create

specification: Updates the content or status of an existing product inquiry, as stored in shopping_mall_ai_inquiries. Permits modification of question, answer (by seller), marked_helpful (by customer), and privacy flag, following business rules. All changes are timestamped. Must validate that only the original asker (question/marked_helpful) or responsible seller (answer) may modify relevant fields, and only if the inquiry is not soft-deleted or already answered (per policy). Request uses IShoppingMallAiInquiry.IUpdate.
description:
Enables a participant to update a product inquiry. Customers may update their question or mark an answer as helpful; sellers may provide (or update) an answer. Admins may override or moderate any field.

Business logic ensures role-based field update rights, timestamping modifications, and maintaining compliance with privacy and answer status rules. Attempting to modify a deleted inquiry or unauthorized field yields appropriate errors. All sensitive updates are logged, and notifications may be triggered for participant engagement.

Common use cases: Customer corrects typo or flags answer as helpful, seller responds to inquiry, admin clears up status. Validation and role checks precede updates.

responseBody.description: Updated full inquiry object reflecting changes, with last updated timestamp. Structure: IShoppingMallAiInquiry.

specification: Deletes (soft deletes) an existing product inquiry identified by inquiryId in shopping_mall_ai_inquiries by setting deleted_at. Hard deletion is not performed. Only the original customer (question author) or admin may delete an inquiry. Sellers cannot remove questions. System maintains an audit trail for compliance. No response body required; success is empty return or HTTP 204.
description:
Soft deletes a product inquiry by setting its deleted_at timestamp. Only the customer who created the question or an admin may remove an inquiry; sellers are not authorized for delete operations.

This operation retains the inquiry for audit/compliance purposes and removes it from all standard queries. All delete actions are logged and may trigger notifications. The record remains in the database but is omitted from API responses by default. Errors include 403 for unauthorized deletion or 404 for not found.
summary: Soft delete (logical delete) a product inquiry by inquiryId.

parameters.name: inquiryId
parameters.description: Target inquiry’s ID (UUID) to (soft) delete.

specification: Retrieves a paginated list of product reviews, reading from shopping_mall_ai_reviews. Each review is linked to product, customer, and (optionally) order for verified purchase checks. Returns all visible reviews except soft-deleted (deleted_at=null). Standard use cases: displaying product feedback, seller dashboards, and admin moderation. This operation supports list retrieval without advanced searching. Sensitive data (such as customer ID, order linkage) is suppressed for public users, while seller/admin gets more structure for audit and moderation. For dashboard/analytics or custom queries use PATCH. Non-deleted records only unless role/admin override.
description:
Retrieves basic lists of customer product reviews for product pages, dashboards, or moderation. Data taken from shopping_mall_ai_reviews, with joins to products, customers, and orders for context. Each review contains rating, comment body, timestamps, customer and product references, and soft deletion state.

Public access is typically restricted to summary views (hide deleted/hidden reviews, suppress sensitive fields). Sellers and admins get more detail, including order references for audit or fraud review. Role-based security and privacy policies apply. Returns empty list if none match. Most common use is for public product pages, seller dashboards, or admin tools.
summary: Get a list of product reviews from shopping_mall_ai_reviews table.

responseBody.description: Paginated array of product reviews (see shopping_mall_ai_reviews structure), with role-based field filtering.

specification: Searches and paginates product review data as defined in shopping_mall_ai_reviews, supporting advanced filter, sort, and analytic scenarios. Queryable by product, customer, order, rating, date ranges, status, and text. Built for operational dashboards, fraud review, and analytic tooling. Request and response comply with IShoppingMallAiReview.IRequest and IPageIShoppingMallAiReview DTOs, respectively. Permissions and privacy enforced based on caller role (public, seller, admin); soft-deleted hidden by default except for admin queries.
description:
Advanced review search supporting complex queries, filtering, and analytics. shopping_mall_ai_reviews fields (product, order, customer, rating, body, date, status, soft deletion) are fully filterable via request structure (IShoppingMallAiReview.IRequest). Response is paged, sorted, and filtered.

Used for admin dashboards, seller analytics, and fraud review systems. Responses comply with business privacy and security rules—public callers cannot see order IDs, deleted reviews, or internal details. Sellers see reviews only for their own products; admin access is global.

Returns paginated results; errors are raised for invalid filters or authorization issues. Help desk, moderation, and compliance scenarios rely on this endpoint.
summary: Advanced search/filter/pagination on product reviews. Supports dashboards and admin tools.

responseBody.description: Paginated, filtered reviews matching search criteria, filtered by role and business rules.

specification: Creates a new product review (customer feedback/rating) for a purchased item. Accepts IShoppingMallAiReview.ICreate with required fields: shopping_mall_ai_product_id (product reviewed), shopping_mall_ai_customer_id (writer), shopping_mall_ai_order_id (purchase/order linkage), rating (int), body (text). Timestamps and ID are generated automatically. Product must have a completed purchase order for this customer; only one review per product, order, and customer is allowed. On success, returns full review object. Validates eligibility, uniqueness constraint, and data completeness.
description:
Customers can submit a product review for a completed purchase—review is stored in shopping_mall_ai_reviews. Caller must be authenticated, and order linkage must validate customer ownership and order status. Body and rating are required, and uniqueness is enforced for (customer, product, order).

Returned object contains submitted data and system-populated fields. Use case: post-purchase review panel or incentive flow. Triggers analytics, optional moderation, and seller notification workflows. Errors: 400 for invalid/missing fields, 409 for duplicate, 403/401 for unauthorized. Audited for compliance requirements.
summary: Create a new product review for a purchased product.

requestBody.description: All required fields for a new review (product, customer, order, rating, body)—see IShoppingMallAiReview.ICreate.

Used for customer author corrections or admin moderation actions/corrections. Returns updated review including admin fields only as role allows.
description:
Allows permitted update to product review fields by reviewId. Customers can edit rating/body of their own reviews as long as not deleted; admins may perform moderation or override deletes. All changes are compliant with business audit and privacy policies.

If the review is already deleted (except for admin), operation fails. Validation is based on author/role and uniqueness constraints. All updates are logged. Use cases: customer wants to correct/update feedback, admin processes moderation action. Errors: 403 for forbidden fields, 404 for not found, 400 for invalid data.

specification: This operation retrieves a paginated list of content moderation actions performed by administrators, operating on the shopping_mall_ai_content_moderations table. This table logs every moderation event (such as delete, hide, warn, restore) performed by admins on bulletin board posts, comments, reviews, and inquiries, with properties including moderation-performer/admin (shopping_mall_ai_admin_id), target content type and ID (content_type, content_id), action, message, and timestamps. This API is intended to support admin dashboards, compliance reporting, and audit trail functionality across the platform's content management features. The endpoint should apply appropriate filtering by admin, content type, action type, and act timestamps, and support pagination and sorting based on audit and review needs.
description:
Retrieve a paginated list of admin content moderation events from the shopping_mall_ai_content_moderations table. This API provides visibility into all moderation actions performed by administrators, including which admin executed the moderation, target type (such as 'bbs_post', 'bbs_comment', 'inquiry', or 'review'), target content ID, performed action, and timestamps.

This endpoint is essential for platform-wide audit trails, compliance monitoring, and investigation workflows. It should be used by admin dashboards and reporting tools to display moderation intervention history and to review corresponding actions for future reference or compliance requirements.

User permissions dictate that only admin roles may access this endpoint, as the moderation logs may contain sensitive details about user-generated content and administrative action rationales. Supporting pagination, filtering by date, and action type is highly recommended for usability.
summary: Get a paginated list of content moderation events from the content_moderations table.

responseBody.description: Paginated results containing summary objects for each moderation event.

specification:
This operation retrieves a list of file metadata records representing files uploaded to the shopping mall platform's attachment system. It operates on the shopping_mall_ai_files table, which stores core metadata for each binary resource, including original file name, URI, extension, MIME type, file size, hash for deduplication, uploader type/id, created_at, and optional deletion state. The business use case involves audit, attachment management, duplicate detection, and linking assets with business records (products, posts, etc).

The operation supports basic listing for admin and file management workflows. Filtering, sorting, and pagination are handled via additional operations. Each file record is atomic and fully auditable, in compliance with legal requirements for data traceability. Only authorized roles (admin, compliance staff) should have access to the full listing of all file records. Sensitive data (e.g., actor details, URIs for restricted assets) should be protected based on requester permissions. The response leverages file summary DTOs to minimize unnecessary data exposure.
description:
Retrieve a list of all files uploaded to the platform for administrative or operational review. This operation pulls file metadata from the shopping_mall_ai_files table, which includes original file name, URI, extension, MIME type, file size, file hash, uploader type/id, creation timestamp, and soft deletion marker. File listing facilitates audit, monitoring for duplicates, and attachment management.

Access to this endpoint must be controlled. Only users with explicit admin or compliance roles are permitted to view the entire list of file assets. File URIs or hashes for sensitive assets may be filtered or redacted unless sufficient authorization is confirmed. For best compliance, file access logs are recommended for any direct downloads resulting from listings.

If the backend implements soft deletion, files marked with a deleted_at timestamp should be included with a status indicator, or filtered out as per business policy. Listing is non-paginated and is intended primarily for administrative overviews; operational listing for end-user browsing must use a filtered or paginated endpoint.

Supported features include: filtering by file type, uploader type/id, creation/deletion timestamps, status (active/deleted), and deduplication hash; sorting by any field; and paginated results. Input parameters must match search fields in the corresponding request DTO.

This endpoint enables compliance monitoring, operational forensics, and detailed file inventory management. It is essential for admins, compliance officers, and asset managers handling gigascale asset stores. Security best practices require all queries to be fully auditable. Pagination and filtering prevent excessive resource use. This endpoint is never public, and role-based visibility must be enforced by the backend.

Results are paginated for operational scalability. The full result includes file summaries and search meta info for UI pagination controls.

This endpoint is restricted to administrative/compliance users, given the sensitivity of file URIs and actor metadata. Query results may be further filtered by role, especially for asset types or actors with privacy constraints. The operation leverages audit-quality tracking—each query is recommended to be logged for compliance review. For role-restricted file types (e.g., legal evidence, PII), only users with explicit grants should be permitted to view results.

Typical use cases include compliance analytics, troubleshooting, and large-scale asset diagnostics. Pagination meta-data is essential for UI feedback and report generation consistency.

Upon creation, the operation returns the full metadata record for the file. Only trusted system actors or admins should invoke this flow. This registration step is performed after the binary file is already stored (e.g., in a CDN or object storage system).

File creation through this endpoint requires admin privilege or trusted system workflow. Hash values must be checked for uniqueness to prevent duplicate asset records. All returned info should be validated and auditable for compliance and operational trace.

specification:
This operation provides a paginated list of file attachment records in the shopping mall AI system, querying the 'shopping_mall_ai_file_attachments' table. It enables users to view all files that have been attached to business objects, such as product images, receipts, or audit documents. This endpoint is fundamental for tracking all file-to-business-object relationships, supporting digital asset management and compliance requirements.

The operation is suitable for admins, content moderators, or technical users needing full visibility over uploaded files and their application within the system. Permissions are enforced so only authorized users can list all file attachments. Pagination is supported to handle potentially large volumes of attachments, ensuring that UI and API consumers can efficiently browse system files.

specification: This operation registers a new legal consent record, corresponding to the shopping_mall_ai_legal_consents table in Prisma. Typically invoked when a customer, seller, or admin user accepts a new policy or legal disclaimer. Required values include user ID, policy code, policy version, consent method, consent time, and optionally consent IP. The operation supports audit and regulatory traceability, ensures that the consent event is atomic, and enforces (user, policy, version) uniqueness within the system (allowing a single consent per version/policy per user).
description:
Register a new legal consent event in the system. This endpoint is called when any actor (customer, seller, admin) agrees to a policy document, necessitating creation of a timestamped consent record. Inputs are validated for referential integrity and compliance with business rules (e.g., only one consent allowed per user/policy/version).

Security and compliance are central: operation is logged and the resulting data is immutable unless explicitly withdrawn. Sensitive fields (such as consent IP and method) are handled according to regulatory requirements.

On success, a new legal consent record is returned reflecting all current values and audit fields.
